theory.introduction: You can send values into a function using parameters. This makes the function dynamic and flexible.
theory.explanation: Define a function with parameters inside the parentheses. Pass actual values (arguments) when calling it. The parameter becomes a variable within the function body.
keyPoints: Arguments are the actual values you pass when calling
You can use multiple parameters separated by commas

task.objective: Create a function that takes a name and greets the person
task.description: Write a function `greet_user(name)` that prints `Hello, <name>!`. Call it with the name `'Shridhar'`.
